title: Verify Games Page
custom_preconds:
1. User should download the App from ROKU Channel store. https://channelstore.roku.com/browse
2. User should Login with the valid account
custom_steps:
1. User should Launch the MLB App 
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Games option
3. Verify the Games page
custom_expected:
User should see the landing page with MLB logo in the upper left side.

User should see "Today's Games" on the left side(Only when the Live game is present) or user should see the current date(or game start date) and  right or left arrow button,Calendar buttons.

The main screen area should be filled with current fixtures / games along with the respective scores for that selected day.

The scores for these fixtures will be shown or hidden based on the option selected in the Settings for "Hide Scores".

title: Verify the In-progress game score
custom_preconds:
1. User should download the App from ROKU Channel store. https://channelstore.roku.com/browse
2. User should Login with a valid account (Annual / Monthly)
custom_steps:
1. User should Launch the MLB App 
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Games option
3. Select the Today's date.

When the user selects the Today's date and select the 'Live' tile
custom_expected: 'Live' game shows game inning, score, batter data, pitcher data, bases, out and team record information.

title: Verify if the pitcher data is not available.
custom_preconds:
1. User should download the App from ROKU Channel store. https://channelstore.roku.com/browse
2. User should Login with a valid account (Annual / Monthly)
custom_steps:
1. User should Launch the MLB App 
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Games option
3. Select the Today's date.

When the user selects the Today's date and select the Preview state tile
custom_expected: In the preview state, if the pitcher data is not available display TBD in the place of the pitcher name.

title: Verify Games Page double header
custom_preconds:
1. User should download the App from ROKU Channel store. https://channelstore.roku.com/browse
2. User should Login with the valid account
custom_steps:
1. User should Launch the MLB App 
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Games option
3. Verify the Games page

WHEN the same teams playing 2 games in day.
custom_expected:
THEN, as a user I should see the first game of a doubleheader with a game time.
And the second game should be the card beside it and say game 2 if it is unscheduled.
Both the game cards and feed select modals should display either game start time or game 2 text

title: Verify Final->Game Score
custom_preconds:
1. User should download the App from ROKU Channel store. https://channelstore.roku.com/browse
2. User should Login with the valid account
custom_steps:
1. User should Launch the MLB App 
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Games option
3. Select the previous date.

When the user selects the previous date and select the Final tile
custom_expected:
Each Game tile below for a date in the past shows game Final State, score, pitcher data, and team record information. 

For the Double header: Once the first game is over I should see the final score on that game card and the game start time of the second game.

title: Verify Pre Game Show
custom_preconds:
1. User should download the App from ROKU Channel store. https://channelstore.roku.com/browse
2. User should Login with the valid account
custom_steps:
1. User should Launch the MLB App 
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Games option


|| 1. WHEN the user selects the Game Tile and One team has started Pregame (Eg. PHI/NYY team is playing and Only PHI has Pregame text)
|| 2. WHEN the user selects the Game Tile and both team has started Pregame
custom_expected:
THEN user should see:

|| 1. User should see the PHI: "Pregame Show" text on the game tile until it is Live. 
|| 2. User should see the "Pregame Show" text on the game tile for both the teams until it is Live.

title: Verify Post Game Show

custom_steps:

|| 2. When the user selects the Game Tile and both team has started Postgames Show
custom_expected:
User should see:

|| 1. User should see the PHI: Postgame Show on the game tile until it is progress 
|| 2. User should see the Postgame Show on the game tile until it is progress

title: Homepage- Radio

2. User should Login with the valid account
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB App
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Home option

WHEN the user selects Homepage game with Audio only
custom_expected:
THEN if the user select the game tile with blackout, then user should see the Feed select modal with blackout messaging with audio only option
If the featured game is blacked out, the button in the featured game should say 'Listen Live'.
Upon selecting an audio option, the homepage refreshes and the featured game is replaced with radio playing.

title: Homepage- Featured Game
custom_preconds:
1. User should download the App from ROKU Channel store. https://channelstore.roku.com/browse
2. User should Login with the valid account
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB App
2. Navigate to Top Nav and select the Home option

WHEN the user selects Homepage game.
WHEN the user selects Featured game
custom_expected:
THEN user should see 
* Live: Has a ‘Watch Live’ button if available and entitled. ‘Listen live’ if audio only.
* Archived game: Has a ‘Watch Recap’ and ‘Watch Full Game’ button
* Free game of the day flag
* Blacked out game / audio only - with appropriate flags

Note: Note that the Recap and Archive is often not available until 30 - 90 mins after the game. The button should not display while the recap/ game is not available. We need to check the end game milestone to know if the game has ended and gone to slate.

title: Authenticated-> Video Playback-> Play/Pause button on the remote
custom_preconds:
1. User should download the App from ROKU Channel store. https://channelstore.roku.com/browse 
2. Should not be a Blackout game
3. User should Login with a valid account
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB App
2. User clicks * button or the Back button on the Remote to invoke the Left Menu
3. Navigate and select the Scores/Video option
4. WHEN the user launches playable content AND attempts to press the Play/Pause button on the remote
custom_expected:
THEN the Play/Pause button is usable
AND button functions as expected (during playback pressing Play/Pause button Pauses the content; during Paused playback pressing Play/Pause button Plays the content) without issue

title: Authenticated -> Playback -> CC -> Verify that Closed Captioning
custom_preconds:
User should download the App from ROKU Channel store. https://channelstore.roku.com/browse
User should login with the Valid credentials
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB App
2. User clicks * button or the Back button on the Remote to invoke the Left Menu
3. Navigate and select the Scores 

WHEN we access any VOD archive content 
AND we begin playback
custom_expected:
THEN we will be able to successfully enable Closed Captioning 
AND we will be able to successfully disable Closed Captioning
Note: Not all VOD content have a source with Closed Captioning. If you do not have CC on the VOD game you selected please check other VOD to pass this Test.

title: Authenticated -> Playback -> Verify that we can play an MLB.tv Stream while utilizing a WiFi Connection
custom_preconds:
1. User should download the App from ROKU Channel store. https://channelstore.roku.com/browse 
2. Login with the valid account
3. User should navigate to Home/Standings/Scores
custom_steps: WHEN user selects an a video (that is not blacked out)
custom_expected:
THEN video playback will stream without issue
note: if wifi strength is poor, the bitrate of video playback should be lower; video quality may not be as good, but it is intended to prevent stuttering playback when device is unable to download and playback the higher bitrate/quality video.

title: Unauthenticated -> Playback -> Verify RR and FF Glyph
custom_preconds: User should download the App from ROKU Channel store. https://channelstore.roku.com/browse
custom_steps:
1. User launches the MLB App
2. User clicks * button or the Back button on the Remote to invoke the Left Menu
3. Navigate and select the Videos option
4. Start Playback
5. Highlight FF
6. Select FF and you see the FF glyph with 2x seek
7. Let glyph fade away
8. Press FF (>>) again to move to 4x seek
custom_expected: After the glyph fades away, if the user interacts with seek again (FF(>>) or Rew(<<)), the glyph reappears.
